intro: Dichapetalum madagascariense var. madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is known for its striking appearance. It grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
